verses.verse: Put <S%G5279><s%> them in mind <S%G5279><s%> to be subject <S%G5293><s%> to principalities <S%G746><s%> and powers, <S%G1849><s%> to obey <S%G3980><s%> magistrates, <S%G3980><s%> to be ready <S%G2092><s%> to every <S%G3956><s%> good <S%G18><s%> work, <S%G2041><s%>

To speak <S%G987><s%> evil <S%G987><s%> of no <S%G3367><s%> man, <S%G3367><s%> to be no <S%G269><s%> brawlers, <S%G269><s%> but gentle, <S%G1933><s%> showing <S%G1731><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> meekness <S%G4236><s%> to all <S%G3956><s%> men. <S%G444><s%>

For we ourselves <S%G2249><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> were sometimes <S%G4218><s%> foolish, <S%G453><s%> disobedient, <S%G545><s%> deceived, <S%G4105><s%> serving <S%G1398><s%> divers <S%G4164><s%> lusts <S%G1939><s%> and pleasures, <S%G2237><s%> living <S%G1236><s%> in malice <S%G2549><s%> and envy, <S%G5355><s%> hateful, <S%G4767><s%> and hating <S%G3404><s%> one <S%G240><s%> another. <S%G240><s%>
But after <S%G3753><s%> that the kindness <S%G5544><s%> and love <S%G5363><s%> of God <S%G2316><s%> our Savior <S%G4990><s%> toward man appeared, <S%G2014><s%>

Not by works <S%G2041><s%> of righteousness <S%G1343><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> we have done, <S%G4160><s%> but according <S%G2596><s%> to his mercy <S%G1656><s%> he saved <S%G4982><s%> us, by the washing <S%G3067><s%> of regeneration, <S%G3824><s%> and renewing <S%G342><s%> of the Holy <S%G40><s%> Ghost; <S%G4151><s%>
Which <S%G3739><s%> he shed <S%G1632><s%> on <S%G1909><s%> us abundantly <S%G4146><s%> through <S%G1223><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> Christ <S%G5547><s%> our Savior; <S%G4990><s%>

That being justified <S%G1344><s%> by his grace, <S%G5485><s%> we should be made <S%G1096><s%> heirs <S%G2818><s%> according <S%G2596><s%> to the hope <S%G1680><s%> of eternal <S%G166><s%> life. <S%G2222><s%>

This <S%G3588><s%> is a faithful <S%G4103><s%> saying, <S%G3056><s%> and these <S%G5130><s%> things I will <S%G1014><s%> that you affirm <S%G1226><s%> constantly, <S%G1226><s%> that they which have believed <S%G4100><s%> in God <S%G2316><s%> might be careful <S%G5431><s%> to maintain <S%G4291><s%> good <S%G2570><s%> works. <S%G2041><s%> These <S%G5023><s%> things are good <S%G2570><s%> and profitable <S%G5624><s%> to men. <S%G444><s%>

But avoid <S%G4026><s%> foolish <S%G3474><s%> questions, <S%G2214><s%> and genealogies, <S%G1076><s%> and contentions, <S%G2054><s%> and strivings <S%G3163><s%> about <S%G3163><s%> the law; <S%G3544><s%> for they are unprofitable <S%G512><s%> and vain. <S%G3152><s%>
A man <S%G444><s%> that is an heretic <S%G141><s%> after <S%G3326><s%> the first <S%G3391><s%> and second <S%G1208><s%> admonition <S%G3559><s%> reject; <S%G3868><s%>
Knowing <S%G1492><s%> that he that is such <S%G5108><s%> is subverted, <S%G1612><s%> and sins, <S%G264><s%> being <S%G5607><s%> condemned <S%G843><s%> of himself. <S%G848><s%>

When <S%G3752><s%> I shall send <S%G3992><s%> Artemas <S%G734><s%> to you, or <S%G2228><s%> Tychicus, <S%G5190><s%> be diligent <S%G4704><s%> to come <S%G2064><s%> to me to Nicopolis: <S%G3533><s%> for I have determined <S%G2919><s%> there <S%G1563><s%> to winter. <S%G3914><s%>
Bring <S%G4311><s%> Zenas <S%G2211><s%> the lawyer <S%G3544><s%> and Apollos <S%G625><s%> on their journey diligently, <S%G4709><s%> that nothing <S%G3367><s%> be wanting <S%G3007><s%> to them.

And let our's <S%G2251><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> learn <S%G3129><s%> to maintain <S%G4291><s%> good <S%G2570><s%> works <S%G2041><s%> for necessary <S%G316><s%> uses, <S%G5532><s%> that they be not unfruitful. <S%G175><s%>

All <S%G3956><s%> that are with me salute <S%G782><s%> you. Greet <S%G782><s%> them that love <S%G5368><s%> us in the faith. <S%G4102><s%> Grace <S%G5485><s%> be with you all. <S%G3956><s%> Amen. <S%G281><s%> It was written to Titus, ordained the first bishop of the church of the Cretians, from Nicopolis of Macedonia.
